item.title: Fred add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "He says, you have to study and learn so that you can make up your own mind about history and everything else but you can’t make up an empty mind. Stock your mind, stock your mind. You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: Fred add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "It may be that our role on this planet is not to worship God--but to create him." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Fred add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "If you wait, all that happens is that you get older." -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Fred add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "The difference between stupid and intelligent people – and this is true whether or not they are well-educated – is that intelligent people can handle subtlety. " -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Fred add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Fred add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Fred add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "The door of a bigoted mind opens outwards so that the only result of the pressure of facts upon it is to close it more snugly." -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Fred add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Fred add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Fred add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "There are certain queer times and occasions in this strange mixed affair we call life when a man takes this whole universe for a vast practical joke, though the wit thereof he but dimly discerns, and more than suspects that the joke is at nobody's expense but his own." -- Herman Melville
